images.description: Front view of the Taj Mahal
Close-up of the marble inlay work
Reflection of Taj Mahal in the water pool

locations.description: The Taj Mahal is a white marble mausoleum located in Agra, India. It was commissioned by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

images.description: Close-up of the carvings on Qutub Minar
The Qutub Minar with surrounding ruins

locations.description: Qutub Minar is a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in Delhi, India. It is a 73-meter tall minaret made of red sandstone, known for its intricate carvings.
The Red Fort, also known as Lal Qila, is a historic fortification in the city of Delhi, India. It served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors for around 200 years.

images.description: View of Gateway of India from the sea
Gateway of India illuminated at night

locations.description: The Gateway of India is an arch-monument located in Mumbai, India. It was built to commemorate the visit of King George V and Queen Mary to India in 1911.
The Jaipur City Palace is a historic palace complex situated in the heart of Jaipur, Rajasthan. It is known for its stunning architecture and rich history.
Mysore Palace, also known as the Amba Vilas Palace, is a historic palace located in Mysore, Karnataka. It is known for its magnificent architecture and royal heritage.

images.description: Detail of the lattice windows of Hawa Mahal
Panoramic view of Hawa Mahal from the top

locations.description: Hawa Mahal, or the Palace of Winds, is a palace in Jaipur, Rajasthan. It is known for its unique fa√ßade with 953 small windows, designed to allow royal ladies to observe street festivities without being seen.
The Elephanta Caves are a network of sculpted caves located on Elephanta Island near Mumbai. They are famous for their rock-cut temples and sculptures dedicated to Hindu gods.

images.description: The Konark Sun Temple's main structure
Intricate carvings on Konark Sun Temple

locations.description: The Konark Sun Temple is a 13th-century CE Sun temple at Konark, Odisha. It is known for its exquisite architecture and intricate sculptures, representing the chariot of the Sun god.

images.description: Ancient ruins within Ranthambore National Park

locations.description: Ranthambore National Park is a wildlife reserve in Rajasthan, India. It is known for its population of Bengal tigers and its scenic beauty with ancient ruins.
Hampi is a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Karnataka. It is known for its well-preserved ruins of the Vijayanagara Empire, including temples, monuments, and palaces.

images.description: View of Shimla from the hills

locations.description: Shimla is the capital city of Himachal Pradesh, known for its scenic beauty and pleasant climate. It is a popular hill station surrounded by picturesque hills.
Goa is known for its stunning beaches, vibrant nightlife, and Portuguese heritage. Its beaches, including Anjuna, Baga, and Calangute, are famous for their golden sands and clear waters.

images.description: Scenic view of backwaters and lush greenery

locations.description: The backwaters of Kerala are a network of interconnected canals, rivers, lakes, and inlets. They offer a unique experience of tranquil boat rides and scenic landscapes.

images.description: The grand entrance of Jaisalmer Fort
Golden sandstone walls of Jaisalmer Fort

locations.description: Jaisalmer Fort, also known as Sonar Quila, is a 12th-century fort located in the city of Jaisalmer, Rajasthan. It is renowned for its stunning golden sandstone architecture.

images.description: Main entrance tower of Meenakshi Temple

locations.description: The Meenakshi Temple is a historic Hindu temple located in Madurai, Tamil Nadu. It is known for its intricate sculptures and towering gopurams (gateway towers).
The Ajanta Caves are a group of Buddhist rock-cut caves located in Maharashtra. They are known for their beautiful frescoes and sculptures depicting the life of Buddha.
Mahabalipuram, also known as Mamallapuram, is a historic town in Tamil Nadu. It is known for its ancient rock-cut temples and sculptures, including the Shore Temple and the Five Rathas.

images.description: Laxman Jhula suspension bridge in Rishikesh
Yoga classes by the Ganges in Rishikesh

locations.description: Rishikesh is a city in Uttarakhand known for its spiritual significance and yoga retreats. It is located along the banks of the Ganges River and is a popular destination for meditation and adventure sports.

images.description: Sunrise over the Ganges in Varanasi
Traditional boat ride on the Ganges

locations.description: Varanasi, also known as Benares or Kashi, is one of the oldest living cities in the world. It is famous for its ghats along the Ganges River, spiritual rituals, and vibrant culture.
Darjeeling is a hill station in West Bengal, known for its tea plantations, stunning views of the Himalayas, and the famous Darjeeling Himalayan Railway.
Agra Fort is a historical fort located in Agra, India. It served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors until 1638 and is known for its impressive Mughal architecture.

images.description: Clock Tower and Sardar Market in Jodhpur

locations.description: Jodhpur, known as the Blue City, is located in Rajasthan. It is famous for its blue-painted houses, the majestic Mehrangarh Fort, and vibrant markets.
Chennai is the capital city of Tamil Nadu, known for its beautiful beaches, historic temples, and colonial architecture. Marina Beach is one of its most popular attractions.
Udaipur, also known as the City of Lakes, is famous for its picturesque lakes, palaces, and romantic ambiance. The City Palace and Lake Pichola are major attractions.
Pushkar is a town in Rajasthan known for its holy lake, Brahma Temple, and the annual Pushkar Camel Fair. It is a significant pilgrimage site for Hindus.
The Andaman Islands are a group of islands in the Bay of Bengal known for their pristine beaches, clear waters, and vibrant coral reefs. They offer excellent opportunities for snorkeling and diving.

Sikkim is a small state in northeastern India known for its stunning views of the Himalayas, including Kanchenjunga, the third-highest peak in the world. It is also known for its monasteries and trekking routes.
Delhi, the capital city of India, is known for its rich history and diverse culture. Major attractions include India Gate, Humayun's Tomb, and the Lotus Temple.
Bangalore, also known as Bengaluru, is known for its green spaces, pleasant climate, and tech industry. Key attractions include Bangalore Palace, Ulsoor Lake, and various gardens.
Amritsar, located in Punjab, is known for the Golden Temple, a major Sikh pilgrimage site. It also features the Jallianwala Bagh Memorial and the Wagah Border Ceremony.
Khajuraho is known for its stunning temples with intricate erotic sculptures. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in Madhya Pradesh.
Pondicherry is known for its French colonial architecture, serene beaches, and spiritual ashrams. It offers a unique blend of Indian and French cultures.
Gulmarg is a popular hill station and ski resort in Jammu and Kashmir. It is known for its stunning snow-capped landscapes and the Gulmarg Gondola, one of the highest cable cars in the world.
Chandigarh is a planned city known for its modern architecture, designed by Le Corbusier. Major attractions include the Rock Garden, Sukhna Lake, and Rose Garden.
Madurai is an ancient city in Tamil Nadu known for the Meenakshi Temple, a significant Hindu pilgrimage site. It has a rich cultural and historical heritage.

images.description: Ranthambore Fort view from the park

locations.description: Ranthambore National Park is a renowned wildlife sanctuary in Rajasthan, known for its population of Royal Bengal tigers and diverse wildlife. The park is also home to the historic Ranthambore Fort.
